title: LC circuits - inductance and oscillation freq

content.question: A student constructs an <math alttext="L C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>LC</mi></math> circuit using a charged capacitor with capacitance <math alttext="3.0 microfarads" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>Î¼F</mi></math> and an inductor with unknown inductance. If the frequency of oscillation of the circuit is <math alttext="250 hertz" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>250</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>Hz</mi></math>, what is the inductance of the inductor?

choices.label: <math alttext="0.14 henrys" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.14</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></math>
<math alttext="0.19 henrys" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.19</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></math>
<math alttext="0.82 henrys" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.82</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></math>
<math alttext="210 henrys" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>210</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="0.14 henrys" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.14</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></math>

topic.text: 13.6: Circuits with Capacitors and Inductors (LC Circuits)

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
